Comment: no -kə. Assumption that the vowel is /i/ was wrong.
Full form potentially features a supine suffix and what is described as a hortative suffix.
The prefix ow- is stated to occur with the verb stem nɨkɨ.
The root am does not occur with first person.
unclear if lengthened or not (kɨt- or k-?)
Werikyana has long e in this verb, assuming the same pattern for Proto-Waiwaian allows reconciling the divergent Waiwai and Hixkaryána forms.
The w could potentially also be a reflex of the Sa class marker *w-, rather than 1Sa *w-.
As all verbs except to ‘to go’, this verb is analyzed as V-initial by meira2003primeras, but unprefixed forms are consistently C-initial.
*ɨ -> ə after labials. Pinto (2022: 83) interprets the vowel as part of the stem, but the same prefix is found with *ge* ‘say’.
No other verb has nâ-; *ge* ‘say’ does not become *ke*.
